p: Given the results of non-human-vertebrates’ natural infection, experimental investigations on host susceptibility to CHIKV were mostly conducted in NHPs and rodents, with the double aim of studying their potential role as a reservoir, and of establishing animal models of infection (reviewed in [ 65]). These studies show the higher susceptibility of infant or immunodeficient mice (as compared to adult mice), the infection of Rhesus and Cynomolgus macaques (i.e., Macaca mulatta and Macaca fascicularis), widely used experimental models, and of bats—a well-known reservoir involved in the spreading of emerging viruses.
